p: Zhong and colleagues assessed the anti-osteoarthritic properties of sclareol in IL-1Î²-induced rabbit chondrocytes and in a rabbit model of osteoarthritis induced by ACLT [ 62]. Sclareol inhibited MMP, iNOS, and COX-2 expression, while increasing the TIMP-1 expression in vitro. It was also able to ameliorate cartilage degradation in vivo.
